alert.note: Alert for Cass; Champaign; De Witt; Logan; Macon; Mason; McLean; Menard; Morgan; Piatt; Sangamon; Scott; Tazewell; Vermilion; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 10:45AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, highest north of a Beardstown to Danville line. Winds gusting up to 40 mph Tuesday night into Wednesday morning potentially leading to blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central and west central Illinois. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... The accumulating snow will occur before sunrise Tuesday, and again after sunset, with mostly rain during the daylight hours. This period of rain could cause some of the snow on the ground to melt before the second round moves through Tuesday night, making accumulations appear to be less.
info.instruction: The snow will be a very wet snow, making it very difficult to shovel. Move only small amounts of snow with each pass of the shovel, and take frequent breaks. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com
